Oddly (or interestingly) enough, I have studied enough programming to 
understanding what you all are talking about because I accidently 
wrote a C program that really messed with the computer because of 
using so big of an array.

What I am actually thinking is the best solution might be is a set of 
if-then tests that prevent accidently or delibrate crossings over from 
positive to negative numbers.  Simply put if a value would cross over 
from positive to negative values, the value becomes automatically set 
at the maximum.

One strong suggestion is that in the future, make it possible for a 
player to see what scenarios numbers that team has beat.

My other suggestion would be to separate experience levels into the 
whole part (the experience level) and the fractional part (the amount 
of experience above that level).  I found that at really high levels 
(200 and up), I could only spend enough money to go up 10 experience 
levels at a time without resetting.

On the scenario level editor, I would suggest making it impossible to 
create anything (opponents, potions, etc) higher than level 1023.  As 
much as I am against placing limits, in order to keep characters from 
gaining too much experience and too much money which causes the game 
to crash, some limits have to be in place.  I would also like the 
scenario level editor to be able to let my copy an object and paste it 
somewhere else.
